title: Sampler, 1795
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem and satin stitches on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Olive Bosworth's sample aged ten years worked May 1795
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Donor's notes: "Mercur Collection Cat. #36." According to Bolton & Coe, American Samplers (see published references) this sampler belonged to Mrs. Robert Mercur at that time (1921)
description:
The field is divided in two by a band of pink with flowers. Above, bands of alphabets, and below a verse and inscription: 
Olive Bosworth is my name 
And with my needle I work the same
A time to learn and my parents give
I will neer forget it while I live
Olive Bosworths sample aged ten years worked May 1795

With a floral vine border. All of the ground colors (black, pink, and pale green) are embroidered.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1795. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem and satin stitches on plain weave foundation. 1975-86-4.
